SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: (4) In performing its functions under this Act, the Inland Revenue shall have due regard to any directions from the Secretary of State.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 2, page 1, line 13, leave out ‘2002’ and insert ‘1992’.
Clause 2, page 2, line 4, leave out subsections (3) and (4).
Clause 2, page 2, line 10, leave out subsection (5).
Clause 3, page 2, line 29, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 3, page 2, line 31, at end insert—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(1A) Regulations under subsection (1) may not impose a requirement that the charge levied by the account provider must be set at less than 1.5 per cent. of the total value of the relevant funds under management by the account provider, divided by the number of child trust funds held with the account provider.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 3, page 2, line 32, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 3, page 2, line 39, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 3, page 3, line 2, leave out ‘child trust funds’ and insert ‘baby bonds’.
Clause 4, page 3, line 16, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 4, page 3, line 18, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 5, page 3, line 35, leave out from ‘may’ to ‘apply’ in line 37.
Clause 5, page 3, line 38, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 5, page 3, line 39, at end insert ‘in accordance with the provisions of subsections (3A) and (3B).

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(3A) An application for the opening of a child trust fund may take the form of the responsible person—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: giving the voucher to an account provider, or
otherwise informing the account provider that he is a responsible person who has been issued with a voucher.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: (3B) Regulations may prescribe—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: the period beginning with the day on which the voucher is issued within which an application may be made, and
the means by which information given in accordance with subsection (3A) must be provided and authenticated.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 5, page 3, line 40, leave out ‘receipt of the voucher’ and insert ‘provision of the application’.
Clause 5, page 3, line 41, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 5, page 3, line 43, at end add—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(5) In the case of any child to whom section [funds for children other than eligible children](1)(a) applies, a responsible person may apply to open for the child with an account provider a child trust fund of any description provided by the account provider.
(6) On receipt of an application under subsection (5) the account provider must—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: open, in accordance with regulations, a child trust fund of that description for the child, and
inform the Inland Revenue in accordance with regulations.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 6, page 4, line 2, leave out ‘this section’ and insert ‘subsection (3)’.
Clause 6, page 4, line 4, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 6, page 4, line 7, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 6, page 4, line 10, leave out ‘section’ and insert ‘subsection’.

Clause 6, page 4, line 15, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 6, page 4, line 18, at end insert—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(4A) In the case of any child to whom section [funds for children other than eligible children](1)(b) applies, the Inland Revenue must, upon application by a nominated person, apply to open for the child with an account provider selected Page 5by the nominated person a child trust fund of a description provided by the account provider and specified by the nominated person in his application.
(4B) The account provider must—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: open, in accordance with regulations, a child trust fund of that description for the child, and
inform the Inland Revenue in accordance with regulations.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 6, page 4, line 20, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.
Clause 6, page 4, line 20, after ‘Revenue’, insert ‘or by a nominated person’.
Clause 6, page 4, line 20, at end add—

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(6) In this section “nominated person” means a person who—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: has informed the authority in whose care a child to whom section [funds for children other than eligible children](1)(b) applies of his intention to subscribe to a child trust fund in respect of the child,
is not under the age of 18 or, in Scotland, 16, and
has satisfied the authority in question that he is a fit and proper person to subscribe to such a fund.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: (7) In determining whether a person is a fit and proper person for the purposes of subsection (6)(c), the authority shall have particular regard to any family relationship between the person and the child in question.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 7, page 4, line 23, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(1A) Regulations under subsection (1) must prescribe an initial contribution of nil in respect of any child trust fund held by a child born before 1st September 2002.’.

Amendment.Text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Clause 8, page 4, line 35, leave out ‘child trust fund’ and insert ‘baby bond’.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: ‘(2A) Regulations under subsection (2) may prescribe a contribution of nil in respect of any child trust fund held by a child born before 1st September 2002.’.

New_C_STitle_PgfTag.ClauseTitle_text: Funds for children other than eligible children

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: The provisions of this section apply to a child if the child was born after 31st August 1992 and before 1st September 2002 and either—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: a person is entitled to child benefit in respect of the child, or
entitlement to child benefit in respect of the child is excluded by the provisions specified in subsection (2)(a) or (b) (children in care of authority),

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: The provisions referred to in subsection (1)(b) are—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: paragraph 1(c) of Schedule 9 to the
Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 (c. 4) and regulations made under it, and
paragraph 1(1)(f) of Schedule 9 to the
Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 (c. 7) and regulations made under it.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: The provisions of section 2(3) to (6) shall apply to eligibility under this section as they apply to eligibility under that section.
Regulations may amend subsection (1) by substituting for the reference to 1st September 2002 a reference to an earlier date.’.

New_C_STitle_PgfTag.ClauseTitle_text: Additional contributions by Inland Revenue for children in care

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: If this section applies to a child the Inland Revenue must inform the account provider with whom a child trust fund is held by the child that this section applies to the child.
If the account provider makes a claim to the Inland Revenue in accordance with regulations, the Inland Revenue must pay to the account provider such amount as is prescribed by regulations.
The amount prescribed by regulations under subsection (2) shall be expressed as a percentage of the current rate of child benefit.
On receipt of the payment the account provider must credit the child trust fund with the amount of the payment.
This section applies to a child if—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: a child trust fund is held by the child, and
the child was first an eligible child by virtue of section 2(1)(b).’.

New_C_STitle_PgfTag.ClauseTitle_text: Income disregard for purposes of income-related benefits, etc.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: In determining the matters specified in subsection (2), no regard shall be had of income and gains arising on—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: Inland Revenue contributions to,
subscriptions to, and
investments under

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: Those matters are—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: eligibility for,
entitlement to, and
levels of

TextContinuation.TextContinuation_text: the benefits and credits specified in subsection (3) in respect of the holder of a child trust fund.

SubSection_PgfTag.SubSection_text: The following are specified in this subsection—

Paragraph_PgfTag.Para_text: child tax credit,
Council Tax benefit,
housing benefit,
income support,
income-based jobseeker’s allowance, and
working tax credit.’.

Longtitle.text.AmedTextCommitReport_PgfTag: Title, line 1, leave out ‘child trust funds’ and insert ‘baby bonds’.
